subject: AI & Agents
title: Humanoid Robots: Walking Among Us
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Humanoid Robots: Walking Among Us.

hook.text: Figure, Tesla, and Agility are building humanoid robots for warehouses. Real ones. Shipping soon.

buildup.text: Humanoid robots need AI for balance, manipulation, navigation, and understanding spoken commands.

discovery.text: Foundation models for robotics learn general skills from video, then fine-tune for specific tasks.

twist.text: The human world is designed for human bodies. Humanoid shape is an advantage, not a vanity project.

climax.text: The robot labor market could be worth trillions. The race to build reliable humanoids is accelerating.

punchline.text: We built a world for human bodies. Now we're building bodies to match.

quiz.question: Why is humanoid shape advantageous for robots?
options: The human world is designed for human-shaped bodies
